image.altText: A man in a button-up shirt and jeans, walking towards the courthouse while holding his wife's hand.

props.synopsis: A key witness faces allegations that he was a cocaine dealer among explosive claims aired in the trial of Netflix star and celebrity crocodile wrangler Matt Wright.

title.children: 'Something wasn't right': Allegations heard against Matt Wright so far

image.altText: Emissions from a smoke stack illustrating carbon pollution

props.synopsis: Environment groups and researchers say that a troubling trend of weakening environmental protections in Western Australia is now being mirrored in the Northern Territory, following the release of a new emissions policy this week.

title.children: Environment groups say a worrying WA environment trend is taking place in the NT

image.altText: A police man stands between a police vehicle and residential fence.

props.synopsis: A 62-year-old man has died in police custody during the execution of a search warrant at a home in Palmerston, south of Darwin.

title.children: Police investigating man's death in custody south of Darwin

image.altText: A black and white headshot of Douglas Crabbe.

props.synopsis: In 1983, Douglas Crabbe slammed his semi-trailer into the side of a Central Australian pub, killing five people. Survivors say he should never be released from jail.

title.children: 'Never-ending nightmare': Call for Uluru mass murderer to remain in jail

image.altText: A large poster saying 'Justice for Kumanjayi White' laid on the lawn, with other protest posters and people surrounding.

props.synopsis: NT police have provided an update on their investigation into the Warlpiri man's death in custody in Alice Springs, saying it is at an "advanced state" but still waiting on a forensic pathology report.

title.children: Police say investigation into Kumanjayi White's death at 'advanced state'

image.altText: Blue taxi rank sign with white bold writing.

props.synopsis: With fewer than 15 wheelchair taxis in town and providers fearful of having "their windows rocked" after dark, people with disabilities in Alice Springs feel deserted and forgotten.

title.children: Lack of accessible taxis after dark leave people with disability feeling forgotten

image.altText: A composite image showing six book covers on a peach background

props.synopsis: Darren McCallum's daughter inspired him to write his first book for young children, The Wobbly Bike, which is among the winners of the 2025 CBCA Book of the Year awards.

title.children: 'Pinch-yourself moment' for Darwin tradie who wins children's book award

image.altText: An aerial photo of a large house with solar panels on the roof.

props.synopsis: Renewable energy advocates are urging the West Australian government to throw more of its weight behind rooftop solar and batteries, saying the state is running out of time to replace coal with large-scale green power projects.

title.children: Just 13pc of rooftop solar capacity realised, advocates say

image.altText: Jim Chalmers

props.synopsis: As the roundtable nears, the list of ideas has grown longer, more ambitious and often contradictory.

title.children: Tinkering at the edges of productivity may cost more than we realise

image.altText: Fire takes over the sugarcane field with flames beginning to reach into the sky.

props.synopsis: After years of mostly green harvesting, cane farmers around Mackay are reaching for the drip torch this season to get rid of old plantings that could not be harvested last year.

title.children: Once a relic of the past, cane fires are burning in Queensland again

image.altText: A man and a woman in snow gear stand on skis in the mountains.

props.synopsis: Two cross-country skiers who were forced to spend a night in a blizzard following equipment failure warn other adventurers to be prepared for anything.

title.children: Preparation saves skiers who spent night in blizzard after gear failure

image.altText: Chinese and Australian flags at an event in Shanghai

props.synopsis: The extensive statement from China's state security ministry accuses Australian leaders of deliberately pushing a false story about the threat Beijing poses to the country.

title.children: China claims it has foiled Australian spies on its shores in stinging rebuke

image.altText: Two men pose for a photo on a train platform

props.synopsis: When Michael Theo appeared on Love on the Spectrum, viewers were drawn to his authenticity and determination. While he didn't find love, he was able to use his profile to springboard into a career where he says he's found his true purpose. But for many autistic people, these kinds of opportunities are hard to come by.

title.children: Michael Theo on the power of meaningful work and being given a 'chance'

image.altText: A composite image of Thai beauty queen Panadda Wongphudee and Cambodian military spokeswoman Maly Socheata.

props.synopsis: A deadly border clash between Thailand and Cambodia has devolved into a fierce online propaganda war with fake news flying on both sides.

title.children: 'She is more beautiful': Thailand enlists beauty queen into border conflict

image.altText: Jess Hill poses for a photo on a tan leather sofa wearing a black dress, her arms folded in front of her

props.synopsis: A Victorian writers festival's code of conduct has set a "dangerous precedent", one author says, after more than 50 writers and moderators withdrew from the event.

title.children: Writers festivals on notice after attempt to 'restrict speech' prompts exodus

image.altText: A woman with brown hair holding a baby with three other children to the left

props.synopsis: Danielle Malseed moved to Mount Gambier thinking housing would be cheap and easy to find, as it had been in the past, but she ended up sleeping on a floor.

title.children: Homelessness rises as people move to regions assuming prices still low

image.altText: A mother holds a photo of her late son

props.synopsis: Tasmania is in the midst of a horror year for road deaths. For mothers who have lost children, the pain is beyond comprehension.

title.children: 'You don't believe it's real': Grieving mothers issue warning as road toll soars

image.altText: Coral on a sub-tropical island, showing different colours.

props.synopsis: Researchers hope studies into the health of Lord Howe Island's remote reef will help experts better understand how marine systems are adapting to changing oceans.

title.children: World's most southern coral reef slowly recovers after coral bleaching

image.altText: Indigenous male dressed in cultural attire conducting a traditional smoking ceremony in Townsville.

props.synopsis: A North Queensland community remembers Bindal elder Uncle Alfred Smallwood Senior as a gentle leader who helped men of all ages turn their lives around.

title.children: A 'legend of his time' leaves behind a path of second chances

image.altText: Parramatta children's court

props.synopsis: Three 13-year-old girls are set to front the Children's Court after allegedly beating, stripping and whipping a 14-year-old girl in Sydney's south-west overnight.

title.children: 14yo girl allegedly stripped, whipped with phone cord and recorded by teen trio

image.altText: Mud surrounds a collapsed rooftop.

props.synopsis: Devastating flash flooding has killed more than 200 people, with dozens still missing after heavy rains washed away villages in the remote regions of Kashmir.

title.children: Hundreds of people killed in flash floods in India and Pakistan

image.altText: Fremantle star Nat Fyfe waves to the crowd as he walks off the ground, passing a guard of honour of players and his family.

props.synopsis: Fremantle's 57-point loss to Brisbane puts the Dockers' finals hopes on thin ice, meaning champion Nat Fyfe may not get one final crack at a premiership.

title.children: No Fyfe farewell yet: Longmuir bullish on finals hopes despite big loss to Lions

image.altText: A group of dejected Bulldogs NRL players stand with hands on hips after conceding a try.

props.synopsis: A frustrated Cameron Ciraldo is considering changes to his team after Canterbury fall to a second loss in three games, following a controversial call in the Dragons' loss to the Warriors in Auckland.

title.children: Disappointed Ciraldo threatens to swing axe at Dogs as Dragons coach fumes over Warriors try

image.altText: a cut out blond girl is surrounded by colourful cut out fish.

props.synopsis: The French director is best known for his Oscar-winning film Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind. In his newest project, he team ups with his daughter, Maya.

title.children: Michel Gondry's new film was created to keep his daughter close

image.altText: Evidence tape is seen with a Sexual Assault Evidence Collection Kit.

props.synopsis: It comes despite a ministerial directive that all hospitals should be able to administer forensic tests 24 hours a day.

title.children: Some Queensland victims transferred an hour away to access rape kits

image.altText: For sale sign on Queenslander-style house that needs renovating in a street in Brisbane.

props.synopsis: The latest interest rate cut and new seller laws in Queensland aren't expected to deliver significant changes to house prices.

title.children: New laws won't ease house prices in south-east Queensland, experts say

image.altText: Rowland stands in the prime minister's courtyard smiling.

props.synopsis: Attorney-General Michelle Rowland promises governments will "pull out all stops" to close loopholes being used by child abusers by the end of this year, just hours after saying it could take up to 12 months.

title.children: Government promises to 'pull out all stops' to close child abuser loophole this year

image.altText: A smiling England cricketer stands next to the ground wearing his cap and sunglasses on his head.

props.synopsis: England make cricket history, naming its youngest men's cricket captain in 136 years, as Jacob Bethell will lead the team in a T20 International series in Ireland.

title.children: Jacob Bethell to become England's youngest men's cricket captain at 21

image.altText: A female footballer has tears as she is embraced by her grandparents.

props.synopsis: Players from around the world make up the Palestinian women's national football team, but they are united in their vision to show their strength and push for freedom.

title.children: The Palestinian women's football team is playing for 'identity and resistance'

image.altText: Two police cars with a rounded building in the distance.

props.synopsis: The US state's Attorney General Brian Schwalb has argued in a new lawsuit that Mr Trump is going far beyond his power under the law.

title.children: Washington DC launches court challenge against Trump police takeover

image.altText: Sydney Swans AFLW star Chloe Molloy bends over, yells and pumps her fists in celebration after a goal.

props.synopsis: Sydney Swans begin their AFLW campaign with a spirited win over Richmond thanks to starring performances from Chloe Molloy and debutant Zippy Fish.

title.children: Four goal blast from Chloe Molloy on AFLW return as Swans beat Tigers

image.altText: A man in a red and gold guernsey talks to a dozen young men in red and gold guernseys

props.synopsis: A regional football club in Western Australia is under the spotlight after its now former league coach made a sexist slur about influencer Tammy Hembrow.

title.children: Football coach fired for online sexist slur against Tammy Hembrow

image.altText: Rathy, Logitha and Lolitta Barthlote

props.synopsis: A former Coalition immigration minister joins calls for the government to resolve the status of around 8,000 asylum seekers who arrived between 2012 and 2013 and remain in legal limbo.

title.children: Thousands of asylum seeker families left in bridging visa limbo

image.altText: A man in a suit and tie stands outside the Supreme Court

props.synopsis: The fake submissions included fabricated quotes from a speech to the state legislature and non-existent case citations purportedly from Victoria's Supreme Court.

title.children: Senior lawyer files AI-generated submissions in Victorian teen murder case

image.altText: A group poses for a photo on chairs in front of a row of national flags.

props.synopsis: The Pacific's leaders are grappling with Solomon Islands' contentious decision to block all outsiders from the region's most important annual meeting next month. So what does the episode say about how strategic competition is reshaping the region?

title.children: Why both China and Taiwan aren't welcome at the Pacific's top meeting next month
